description: Dive into "Capture the Magic of Madrid" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capture the Magic of Madrid

places.generalDescription: The Royal Palace of Madrid, an 18th-century ridge-top palace, is a must-visit for its grandeur and historical significance. While it's still the official residence of Spain's royal family, it's more about exploring the palace's history and the country than catching a glimpse of royalty. With over 3,000 rooms including the Royal Kitchen, Royal Armory, Painting Gallery, and a Hall of Mirrors reminiscent of Versailles, there's plenty to explore inside.

sources.snippet: If you don‚Äôt whittle away the whole morning staring at the Debod‚Äôs reflecting pool, make your way south to the royal family‚Äôs official residence. Spaniards can boast that they have the largest royal palace in Europe ‚Äî the Baroque building contains a shocking 3,418 rooms!. Don‚Äôt get too caught up in the sheer size of the palace, however, as nearby there are many cool statutes, cathedrals, gardens, and other spots to get photographically creative:
sources.shortName: My Favorite Photo Spots in Madrid

sources.snippet: The Royal Palace of Madrid, an architectural marvel and the official residence of the Spanish Royal Family, is a must-visit Madrid photography spot. Its opulent facades, stunning courtyards, and lavish interiors provide a majestic backdrop for your photos. Don‚Äôt miss the opportunity to capture the Changing of the Guard ceremony, which adds a touch of pomp and circumstance to your shots.
sources.shortName: Madrid Photography Spots: Capturing the Spirit of Spain's Vibrant Capital
Most Instagrammable Places In Madrid

sources.snippet: The Royal Palace is actually Instagrammable from all around the building. The architecture of the Palace is beautiful and we loved checking out all the perspectives. You need to buy an entrance ticket to the Palace to take a photo in front of the building, but the building is also very Instagrammable from Plaza de Oriente and the Sabatini Gardens.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Places in Madrid

sources.snippet: From the Royal Palace, you are able to see the Almudena Cathedral perfectly. If in your list of the most instagrammable places in Madrid, there is the Almudena Cathedral, you can‚Äôt miss the Royal Palace either. This beautiful palace, which is the official residence of the Royal Family, is one of the best spots in Madrid to consider.
sources.shortName: 15 COOL Madrid Instagram Spots

sources.snippet: Instagram success is guaranteed when the subject is the largest palace in Europe. Strike a playful pose‚Äìthe typical jumping picture is a safe bet‚Äìor dress up for your #ootd snap and walk around this 18th-century baroque gem while someone snaps you. If you go inside, you‚Äôll find even more Instagram-worthy possibilities
sources.shortName: 10 of the most Instagrammable places in Madrid

sources.snippet: The Royal Palace is definitely ‚Äúinsta worthy.‚Äù  From the outside, it almost mimics Buckingham Palace with its gate and big front entrance. Behind the palace is the royal gardens, which is another must see. The inside of the palace is full of color and chandeliers and is everything you would want to see in a palace.
sources.siteName: Cats Hostels Official Site | Best in City Center
sources.shortName: The most Instagrammable spots in Madrid 2025

sources.snippet: As one of the largest royal residences in Europe, it‚Äôs no wonder why Madrid‚Äôs Royal Palace is Instagram gold. While the Royal Family doesn‚Äôt actually call the stately palace home, they still use it ceremoniously for important events. Photography is strictly restricted in most of the interior areas of the palace.
sources.shortName: Insider‚Äôs Guide to the Most Instagrammable Places in Madrid

sources.snippet: Next up on this list of the best Madrid Instagram spots is an absolute classic, the Royal Palace of Madrid, or Palacio Real. This  majestic building is one of the city‚Äôs most visited landmarks. Its grand architecture, expansive gardens, and opulent interiors provide countless photo opportunities.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Madrid Instagram Spots in 2025

sources.snippet: The Royal Palace of Madrid is the largest palace in all of Europe. Guests can enter and tour a small percentage of the palace‚Äôs 3,148 rooms but photography is unfortunately not allowed inside. Luckily, the imposing exterior is full of angles and various viewpoints that photograph wonderfully.
sources.shortName: Top 82 Photo Spots in Madrid in 2025

sources.snippet: The Royal Palace is one of the most impressive venues in Madrid. This historic building is perfect for fashion shoots, as it offers a lot of open spaces and manicured gardens. In addition, the architecture of the palace is stunning and can be a perfect backdrop for your images.
sources.shortName: The best locations for photo shoots in Madrid

sources.snippet: The Royal Palace of Madrid or Palacio Real is one of my favorite palaces in the world. It used to be the official residence of the Spanish royal family. I highly recommend you book a tour so you can learn about the history of everything you‚Äôre seeing.
sources.siteName: The Solo Travel in Style Blog
sources.shortName: The best Madrid Instagram spots for top pictures

sources.snippet: We'll save you some counting: Madrid‚Äôs Royal Palace has over 3,000 rooms. The Royal Guard is changed every Wednesday and Saturday with a special ceremony on the first Wednesday of every month (except January, August and September).
sources.shortName: Instagrammable spots in Madrid

sources.snippet: There are many places inside and out to capture some amazing shots. This is a baroque style palace with lots of ground space to explore. Visitors flock here for its beauty and magnificence.
sources.shortName: Best photography spots in Madrid Spain

sources.snippet: Then go visit the Royal Palace where you will be able to take your best photos at the main entrance on the Plaza de Oriente.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Madrid Photo Spots
The Best Madrid Photography Locations - Popular Spots
Top 7 Instagrammable Places: the best photo spots in Madrid

places.name: Royal Palace of Madrid

reviews.text:
We arrived early in the morning and were among the first visitors - absolutely worth it. No crowds, no rush. The whole experience felt calm and enjoyable.

The palace itself is stunning - rich interiors, impressive halls, and beautiful details everywhere. It doesn't take forever to walk through, but it definitely leaves a strong impression. You feel the history, the scale, and the elegance without being overwhelmed or exhausted.

Highly recommend coming early - it makes all the difference.

Experience European Royalty at it's peak in Royal Palace of Madrid! It was enchanting to see how the name and decorative matched. The color of walls or wallpaper was in sync with fabrics on sofas, curtains, and even carpet on floor.
Very beautiful paintings on ceilings too!
Great Luxury to witness!!

Keep sufficient time when you visit the Palace and choose a cooler time to go.

August might be very hot.

Must visit if you like history. This place is simply amazing. The old palace of the Spanish crown. Inside are paintings and furniture from hundreds of years ago all preserved for you to see. This is Europe's largest palace and the grandeur and  opulence shows it. You can visit yourself, but they also offer guided tours for only a few euros more. They run guided tours in Spanish all day long, but also run English guided tours twice a day. They also have Italian guided tours offered distractions as well. I works recommended getting a guided tour as there's so much history inside that you won't know about. Very fascinating.

places.generalDescription: El Retiro Park, one of the largest parks in Madrid, was previously owned by the Spanish Monarchy. This 19th-century park features a boating lake, rose garden, numerous fountains, and statues.

sources.snippet: Retiro Park, a sprawling green space in the heart of Madrid, is a haven for photographers. The park‚Äôs serene pathways, picturesque gardens, and tranquil lakes provide an idyllic setting for your images. Don‚Äôt miss the chance to photograph the stunning Crystal Palace, a beautiful glass structure that hosts contemporary art exhibitions.
sources.shortName: Madrid Photography Spots: Capturing the Spirit of Spain's Vibrant Capital

sources.snippet: Formerly a royal retreat, El Retiro Park is now Madrid‚Äôs largest public park, popular with locals and visitors alike. Located within the city centre, the 118 hectares of green space has an abundance of beauty. Expect manicured gardens dotted with fountains, sculptures, and architectural monuments ‚Äî a real feast for the senses.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places to Take Photos in Madrid

sources.snippet: The Buen Retiro Park, Retiro Park or simply El Retiro is one of the largest parks of the city of Madrid, Spain. The park belonged to the Spanish Monarchy until the late 19th century, when it became a public park. If you just want to do something for free, this park will definitely take up your free time to explore.
sources.shortName: The Best Photo Spots in Madrid, Spain!

sources.snippet: Buen Retiro Park is one of the largest parks in the center of Madrid that is a great place to walk, sunbathe, take photos, and ride paddleboats. Retiro Park is definitely a must see when you come to Madrid and is a beautiful place to go on a sunny day. It‚Äôs full of trees, caf√©s, fountains, and people.
sources.siteName: Cats Hostels Official Site | Best in City Center

sources.snippet: If you are looking for a quiet place to take photos, you will like the Retiro Park. It‚Äôs a very beautiful park with many fountains, all kinds of different trees and benches. In the middle of the park, there is a pond, which will be the best background for your family photo.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Instagrammable Places: the best photo spots in Madrid

sources.snippet: Retiro Park is Madrid‚Äôs large city park and is filled with beautiful gardens, iconic buildings and a large artificial pond. Retiro is not only the perfect place for a stroll through the park, but also to take some very pretty Instagrammable photos.

sources.snippet: This large urban park has several photographic sights like the striking Monument to Alfonso XII looking over the park‚Äôs rowboat-filled lake. The Crystal Palace has rotating art installations and is fronted by a duck pond.

sources.snippet: The Retiro Park is a large and beautiful park in the Spanish capital. It is so well thought out and there are so many things to explore here. It is the perfect spot for some iconic shots.

sources.shortName: The best Madrid Instagram spots for top pictures
My Favorite Photo Spots in Madrid

places.name: El Retiro Park

reviews.text: I visited El Retiro Park park on the 13th of July. This was my second visit to the park. I first visited this park in December 2024. I experienced the beauty of this park in winter as well as during the summer. This is truly a beautiful park, a calm escape from the bustling city. The sculpture gardens, the rose garden, the great pond is all worth visiting when in this park. Feeding the ducks and turtles in the pond was so amazing. The entire park filled with its greenery is beyond imagination. The most amazing part is that this park was opened to public in 1868 and until this day, the beauty of this park has remained intact! Such a well-maintained park, giving you a feeling of ease, comfort and happiness. I missed boating in December but made it a point to rent a boat for boating this time when I was there. Such an amazing experience to row a boat on your own. It is a great place for families and friends to meet up and have a quiet picnic there with their loved ones. I highly recommend visiting this park when in Madrid!

Scenic üòç | üòå Peaceful

As already 200K comments are saying it : this place is unique, nested in the heart of the vibrant Madrid, it feels hided in the city.

Big forest, wonderful lake, wildlife and architecture : a cocktail that makes your day! ‚òÄÔ∏è

Of course taking the boat was the summit of the day it's a calm and unique experience but don't hesitate to spend hours in the park it worth it üëãüèº

Slow life, savor & enjoy üòâ

The reason I'd like to live in Madrid. This park is gorgeous large and has ample space for walking, running, biking and plenty of space for sun bathing. A lake in the center is beautifully decorated and offers canoeing. When tired, there are several snack shops with delicious food.

places.generalDescription: Palacio de Cristal, also known as the Crystal Palace, is a must-see attraction located in the heart of Retiro Park in Madrid. This iconic and photogenic spot was inspired by London's Crystal Palace and is a stunning conservatory made entirely of glass. Built in 1887, it was originally designed to showcase native plants and objects from the Philippines during Spain's colonial period.

sources.snippet: We can‚Äôt talk about the best Madrid Instagram spots without including Crystal Palace.One of the most iconic and photogenic places is Palacio de Cristal, located in the heart of Retiro Park.If you don‚Äôt know the exact location, don‚Äôt worry because you will find it just random walking in the park. If you really want to get the best shot in Palacio de Cristal, when planning your visit think about what to wear before so you already have an idea of what you wish to archive. The scenario might change depending on the time of the day you are visiting this spot.
sources.shortName: 15 COOL Madrid Instagram Spots

sources.snippet: If you are looking for a romantic and classic photo for your Instagram you need to see Palacio de Cristal. Located in the heart of parque del Retiro, this elegant bulding made by crystal and iron is the favorite place for engagement photos and marriage proposals in Madrid. In order to have the perfect photo go up the small slope and wait for the sunset, you will have a top Instagram photo.
sources.shortName: 10 OF THE MOST INSTAGRAMMABLE PLACES IN MADRID ‚Äì Madrid Photo Tour ‚Äì Things to do, activities and what to see in Madrid

sources.snippet: The Palacio de Cristal was built in 1887 at the heart of El Retiro Park (World Heritage Site adjacent to the Paseo del Prado and its surrounding area) as a place to exhibit exotic plants from the Philippines. The setting, the light, the atmosphere‚Ä¶ As well as photogenic, this spot is absolutely magical.
sources.shortName: Instagrammable spots in Madrid

sources.snippet: Another must-see in the Retiro is Palacio de Cristal, which has been amazing tourists and locals alike since 1887.Do you hear that coming?. It's your likes record.
sources.shortName: The best instagram corners of Madrid

places.name: Palacio de Cristal

reviews.text:
Parque del Retiro in Madrid is an urban oasis that blends natural beauty with cultural richness. One of the park's highlights is the stunning Palacio de Cristal, a beautiful glass and iron pavilion that looks absolutely breathtaking when sunlight pours through its transparent walls. Originally built in 1887 to exhibit exotic plants from the Philippines, today it serves as an exhibition space for contemporary art.

Walking through the park, you can feel the tranquility amidst the bustling city. Locals and tourists alike come here to relax, picnic, or simply enjoy the lush surroundings. The lake nearby offers boating opportunities, and the statues and monuments scattered throughout add a touch of history and elegance.

Whether you are looking for a quiet retreat or a cultural exploration, Parque del Retiro has something to offer. The combination of nature and architectural beauty makes it a must-visit in Madrid.

Such a stunning place in the middle of the park, the architecture is so beautiful and the light inside of it so intelligent built, as a interior designer I was speechless by the beauty and it was like a magical place in the beautiful retiro park!
There are a lot of people so if you want to take a good photo it's not so easy though, maybe you should go really early!
Nice parc and beautiful overview over the river. Recomemnded to make a walk over the aprk and enjoy the peacocks, they are running free!!

places.address: P.¬∫ de Cuba, 4, Retiro, 28009 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sof√≠a is a vast museum showcasing an impressive collection of Spanish 20th-century art, featuring renowned works by artists such as Gris, Dali, Picasso, and Miro. Located near the Atocha train station in Madrid, the museum offers free admission during specific hours on weekdays and weekends.

sources.snippet: The Reina Sofia Museum, a contemporary art museum housed in a former hospital, is a must-visit Madrid photography spot. The museum‚Äôs striking architecture, featuring a mix of old and new, provides a visually interesting backdrop for your images. Don‚Äôt forget to capture the museum‚Äôs impressive glass elevators and the iconic ‚ÄúGuernica‚Äù by Pablo Picasso.
sources.shortName: Madrid Photography Spots: Capturing the Spirit of Spain's Vibrant Capital

places.name: Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sof√≠a

reviews.text:
Truly, truly world class. The exterior of the building was incredible and very imposing. Unique architectural concept.

Upon walking inside, you are immediately confronted with the modern and contemporary art section. These sections were wonderful and it is very interesting for a museum to have both classical and modern / contemporary artworks all in one building. The film installations were quite bizarre to say the least (in a good way), but told an interesting story that I liked.

However, once you ascend up the staircases, you get to enjoy all the art before the modern and contemporary.

My favorite section was about an artist called Nestor de la Torre, an artist from the Canary Islands I did not know about before. His paintings spanned many large rooms, and they were all incredible. The Re√≠na Sof√≠a did a great job on exhibiting many of this little-known artist's works. I must say that his paintings have a quality that upon viewing, you know immediately it is this artist's style. Truly unique, one of a kind. I do not know why he is not represented more in the art scene of today.

Of course, there are the other very famous rooms, which display works by Picasso and Dal√≠. The singular most infamous work on display is Picasso's Guernica, which tells the suffering of war. Some of Dal√≠'s most famous paintings are there as well

I recommend checking out the sketches that Picasso made of the weeping ladies he has displayed in Guernica to get a clear sense of the level of preparation that Picasso did.

Overall, a fantastic museum and great experience. I think this museum - in my opinion - has one of the most intriguing collections of modern art I have seen thus far in all my travels to world class museums. üñºÔ∏è

Please go here if you are in Madrid. The Re√≠na Sof√≠a also has a wonderful, amazing store filled with so many great books that I wanted to take back with me! üòä

We happened to walk across the neighborhood, and my wife said that after their official ticket time that around 7 pm, then there is a free entry before they close at 9 pm. I suppose this is only on weekends. I'm not sure on weekdays. So we decided to take the opportunity and we waited in line ( not that long and good thing everybody seated yet in line along those short walls in front of entrance).
Once ur inside the museum is pretty big with 4 stories. Currently, the 3rd floor is closed. 1st floor and 4th floor has temporary exhibition, so i believe they often update new one. But the main highlight was Pablo Picasso, Guernica' famous painting at 2nd floor room no.205. You can also find Dali painting as well. Most of the people are on the 2nd floor. Rest its pretty much contemporary arts and paintings, which my wife is not a big fan of it. At some points, yes, it is hard to understand and appreciate the beauty, although the 19th/20th century artists do express themselves.
Overall, it was good to see at least one famous Picasso painting. The building layout is a bit confusing, though. Since it was free, it was not bad. Spend 1 and half.

I had an amazing time at the Museo Nacional Centro de Arte! The collection is vast and impressive, featuring stunning pieces of art that left me in awe. The variety of works, from classic to contemporary, is truly remarkable. What I loved most was the ability to search their online collection, making it easy to explore and revisit my favorites. The atmosphere was inspiring, and the staff were welcoming. Highly recommend for any art lover

places.address: C. de Sta. Isabel, 52, Centro, 28012 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Temple of Debod in Madrid is an ancient Egyptian temple that was relocated from Aswan and reconstructed in a picturesque park. It is over 2,000 years old and is the oldest monument in the city. Situated near Parque del Oeste, it offers stunning sunset views from its gardens, making it a favorite spot for both locals and visitors. The temple's interior can be accessed before sunset, as it closes after dark.

sources.snippet: The Temple of Debod, an ancient Egyptian temple gifted to Spain in the 1960s, is a unique and captivating Madrid photography spot. The temple‚Äôs stunning silhouette, surrounded by a tranquil reflecting pool, creates a magical atmosphere ‚Äì especially during sunset. For a humorous twist, try capturing the reactions of passersby who are surprised to find an Egyptian temple in the heart of Madrid!
sources.shortName: Madrid Photography Spots: Capturing the Spirit of Spain's Vibrant Capital

sources.snippet: This Egyptian temple is a must-see for every visitor and is such an easy target for photography; you really can‚Äôt mess up unless you forget to remove the lens cover. Ancient stone structures mirrored by water in the soft glow of sunset or dramatic illumination of the night: there‚Äôs nothing quite like it. This Egyptian temple dates back to 200 B.C.
sources.shortName: The Best Madrid Photography Locations - Popular Spots

sources.snippet: We start with the Temple of Debod , a place that has one of the best sunsets in Madrid. The light that exists when the sun is setting and the water that borders the Temple make for some spectacular photos. Also in the same place is the viewpoint from which we can take a photo of the Royal Palace with the gardens.
sources.shortName: Plans in Madrid: The best places to take photos in Madrid - Casual Hoteles | Web Oficial

sources.snippet: This is a cool place to visit because it is a flashback to Egypt right in the city. This temple is a thousands of years old Egyptian structure that resides in Madrid. It‚Äôs a bit of a hidden gem and is absolutely beautiful towering over the water especially at sunset or sunrise when the lighting is a lovely color.
sources.shortName: Best photography spots in Madrid Spain

sources.snippet: The Temple of Debod is an ancient Egyptian temple located in Madrid. The illumination of the temple at night creates a magical and mysterious atmosphere, which makes it an ideal place to photograph. In addition, the temple is located on a hill, so you can capture stunning views of the city in the background.
sources.shortName: The best locations for photo shoots in Madrid

sources.snippet: This little piece of Egypt is one of the most magical places in Madrid, especially at sunset. The 2,200-year-old Egyptian structure is located in Parque del Oeste and is the truly the city‚Äôs best unkept secret. What was once a hidden romantic spot now serves as the setting for photo shoots of every kind.
sources.shortName: 10 of the most Instagrammable places in Madrid

sources.snippet: One of Madrid‚Äôs best photo spots, the Temple of Debod ‚Äî known to locals as Templo de Debod ‚Äî is a hidden gem. The ancient Egyptian ruins are found in the west side of the city in pretty Parque del Oeste. The beautiful stone temple is set behind two stone archways atop a serene pond with still waters.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places to Take Photos in Madrid

sources.snippet: Temple of Debod (Templo de Debod) is a unique sightseeing spot and is perfect for photos. The temple, built in the 2nd century, was a gift from Egypt and is one of the few ancient Egyptian architectural works outside of Egypt. Temple of Debod is especially beautiful during sunset.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Places in Madrid

sources.snippet: The temple of debod is located next to the Plaza Mayor in the West Park of the city. This monument was initially built in Egypt where it had to be relocated because of the Aswan High Dam construction. That is why in the late 60‚Äôs, the building was transferred in Madrid.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Madrid Photo Spots

sources.snippet: One of the best views over the city can be seen from Temple of Debod. It is one of the most photographed places in Madrid that will make you feel as if you were in Egypt.

places.name: Temple of Debod

reviews.text: Incredible location for sunset in Madrid. Temple itself has cool story which was gifted to King from Egypt but view during sunset is amazing. You can enjoy a cup of drink, families, couples and dogs around you will make your evening great. Also once you are with your drink and sunset, walk down through the Royal Palace (10mins) which is mostly crowded with tourist(easy to follow without map) and take some photos there before sun fully sets as well. From that moment, there are many great small cafes and bistros that you can enjoy some bites while crowd passes by and feel the city with lively buzz

This temple is one of the most overrated places I've seen. There's barely any information around. Apparently, there used to be reflecting pools on both sides, but they're gone now. I had to look it up online because it didn't feel like a historical site at all. As far as I can tell, only a small part of it is original - it's been heavily restored. I think its fame is mostly due to a bandwagon effect. The surrounding park is much nicer - ideal for walking and relaxing. To enter, you have to scan the QR code shown in the picture and wait about 20 minutes. They only allow 15 people inside at a time. I didn't go in, and honestly, I wasn't that curious.

The temple from Egypt has been placed here and when I went through the Google pics, that was looking amazing. There is a pond in there and the temples been placed into the centre, but I went there there was no water in the pond and it wasn't looking like the google suggested pics. Yes I saw the place and a pretty park is around the temple. Nice place to sit and relax, you will definitely have a thoughtful day.

places.address: C. de Ferraz, 1, Moncloa - Aravaca, 28008 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Puerta de Alcal√° is a triumphal arch located near Parque del Buen Retiro, adorned with elegant sculptures and stone carvings. It is one of the ancient gates that provided access to the city and is considered the precursor of famous triumphal arches in other cities. Commissioned by King Charles III in the late 18th century, this neoclassical monument was designed by Italian architect Francesco Sabatini.

sources.shortName: Most Instagrammable Places In Madrid

sources.snippet: Puerta de Alcal√° is a big arch that is in the center of Madrid and is very similar to the infamous Arc de Triomphe in Paris and Brandenburg Gate in Berlin. Puerta de Alcal√° is very close to the entrance of Buen Retiro Park and makes for a perfect Instagram photo. It is a beautiful archway that is in the center of a traffic circle and is surrounded by a patch of flowers.
sources.siteName: Cats Hostels Official Site | Best in City Center
sources.shortName: The most Instagrammable spots in Madrid 2025

sources.snippet: Puerta de Alcal√° is an iconic landmark situated in Plaza de la Independencia. It‚Äôs a grand neoclassical gate, built in the 18th century and is one of Madrid‚Äôs most photogenic spots. Whether you shoot it from afar to capture its full grandeur or focus on its intricate carvings and statues, Puerta de Alcal√° offers endless possibilities for stunning images.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Madrid Instagram Spots in 2025

places.name: Puerta de Alcal√°

reviews.text: Great place , at the entrance of the park of the crystal Palace , which of course has a lot of entrances but this is the best . Next to the great lake and Alfonso II monument a great way to go through the park . Also very close to Cybele Palace , and other monument and a 10 minutes walk to the Prado museo and Museo Naval

After so many visits to Madrid, I finally had the chance to see it in all its glory - two years later, and it was worth the wait.

It had been under renovation during my previous visits, so seeing it fully restored, surrounded by blooming tulips in the heart of spring, was truly a spectacle.

An iconic landmark full of history and elegance. Whether you pass by during the day or stop for photos at sunset, it captures the timeless beauty of the city like few other places.

A Stunning Historical Landmark
Puerta de Alcal√° is a must-see when visiting Madrid. Its impressive architecture and rich history make it one of the city's most iconic sights. Beautiful both day and night, it's the perfect spot for a photo or a peaceful stroll through Retiro Park nearby. Truly a symbol of Madrid's elegance and charm!

places.address: Pl. de la Independencia, s/n, Retiro, 28001 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Parque del Oeste is a sprawling urban park in Madrid, featuring winding paths that lead past conifer and cedar trees. A short cable car ride from Casa de Campo, the park is home to the ancient Temple of Debod, gifted from Egypt in the late 1960s. In May and June, visitors can explore the lesser-known rose garden, known as rosaleda, which showcases hundreds of different rose bushes in full bloom.

sources.snippet: The rose garden is a perfect place to bring out your camera and enjoy capturing the wonders of nature spreading across 30,000 square meters garden. In the central area of the garden, you‚Äôll find a pond with a sculpture of a nymph.
sources.siteName: Hostal Madrid, habitaciones en el centro de Madrid
sources.shortName: The Best Places in Madrid to Take Great Pictures

sources.snippet: Parque del Oeste is a city park in Madrid which is loved by locals. On summer evenings, the park is always very crowded. We loved strolling around the park and looking for Instagrammable spots.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Places in Madrid

places.name: Parque del Oeste

reviews.text: A beautiful park to take a stroll. Very well maintained. There is a huge, free rose garden. You can also walk to the opposite end for amazing views of the city. There is also a nice spot in the middle near the street where you can sit and have drinks. Gorgeous greenery and flowers and plants. A jewel in the city and not very crowded.

Yet another beautiful park within the city limits of Madrid and a really significant one. One end of the park hosts the Temple of Debod even though I couldn't visit it. It was not closed but I didn't get the time to reach there and get some pics. What makes it distinct is that the park comprises a geographically unsymmetrical terrain with slopes where you can sit and enjoy the beautiful sunset. It houses a variety of monuments and also a Bird Observatory within it. Good place to spend your evenings reading or relaxing away from city life!
Just a fabulous and well cared for park. A great way to challenge children (and adults) to run and find their birth year rose winner.

places.address: P.¬∫ de Moret, 2, Moncloa - Aravaca, 28008 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Real Jard√≠n Bot√°nico, also known as the Royal Botanical Garden, is a historic botanical garden located next to the Prado Museum in Madrid. Established in the 18th century, it features three terraces showcasing around 6,000 plant species from around the world. Visitors can enjoy guided tours that delve into the garden's history and cultivation techniques. The garden includes various themed zones such as a Mediterranean garden, tropical garden, and medicinal plant garden.

sources.snippet: In the middle of the city you will encounter this botanical garden, right next to the Retiro Park. Its tropical plants and palm trees will transport you to an exotic country. This place houses more than a million species from the most original to the more common ones such as roses.
sources.shortName: Top ten Instagram worthy spots in Madrid

sources.snippet: Secondly, the Botanical Garden will make your face become the heart eyes emoji.The general ticket costs 4 euros, but students pay half, people over 65 pay 50 cents, and under 18 and teachers can enter for free.
sources.shortName: The best instagram corners of Madrid

places.name: Real Jard√≠n Bot√°nico

reviews.text:
Wonderful garden of almost every major species of tree and plant in the world. The signage for each plant shows the Latin species name and the location  for each plant. There are also special times in the year where each tree or plant blooms. Special when you see the rose garden blooms, late June early July.

The pathways are clear and straight, which brings you into each segment of the garden.

Designated statues pay tribute to special historical figures. Carlos III and others.

The trees are large and provide adequate shade for most of the garden in, which is useful in July August hot months +30C.

Benches are dotted along the paths as well. Fountains can be found throughout.

Special place to recognize the different plant species . There is also a special olive tree from the garden of Gethsemane.

Adults over 18 pay 4‚Ç¨. Otherwise free.

The bonsai exhibit alone was worth the visit!  Amazing collection of delicate bonsai. Met and spoke with a staff member who was trimming one of the bonsai forests. Astounding that some of the trees are at least 1 hundred years old.  This would have been even more beautiful in spring or autumn. The hot summer sun dried up all the roses, which I assume would have been gorgeous.

Incredible! For the price of 4‚Ç¨ (or 1‚Ç¨ for the discounted price) it's worth it. Really nice, clean and plenty of plants inside.

After your visit in the Prado museum the garden is literally next to it, you can have a relaxing walk there. Although picnic is not allowed, there are more than plenty of benches to rest.

places.generalDescription: Jard√≠n El Capricho de la Alameda de Osuna, also known as "The Whim," is a stunning 18th-century garden located in the district of Barajas. Spanning 14 hectares, this romantic masterpiece features an artificial river, lakes, woods, and various architectural wonders such as temples. Commissioned by the Duke and Duchess of Osuna in 1780, it reflects their enlightened taste and support for the arts.

sources.snippet: If you want to get away from the noisy center and discover a more quiet green zone we recommend you Parque del Capricho. In this charming park you will find loads of hidden and photogenic spots as Plaza de los Emperadores and Fuente del Parque that will work perfectly for your Instagram. And if you are lucky you could see some squirrels!
sources.shortName: 10 OF THE MOST INSTAGRAMMABLE PLACES IN MADRID ‚Äì Madrid Photo Tour ‚Äì Things to do, activities and what to see in Madrid
Best Fall Photo Spots in Madrid

places.name: Jard√≠n del Capricho

reviews.text: Gorgeous park, really worth it even if it's a little far from the center. Recommend for a romantic afternoon walk, just gorgeous and many surprises all around the park. Forget about the map and just wander around, you'll find beautiful details all around.

Very beautiful place,,natural views, clean, quite, and absolutely attractive.
Their behavior was awesome,
It was raining and they gave us an umbrella ü•∞.
Thanks everyone ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

This has got to be one of my all time favorite parks.  From the immaculate landscaping to the lush natural beauty and history, it's truly like walking around a fairy tale.  They don't allow dogs which makes sense since leash laws are either non applicable or un-enforced in Madrid and there are lots of landmarks and monuments in the park.  It's a great spot for a stroll or romantic outing. Highly recommend.

places.address: P.¬∫ de la Alameda de Osuna, 25, Barajas, 28042 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: C√≠rculo de Bellas Artes is a renowned arts and cultural center in Madrid, offering a variety of attractions. The 1920s skyscraper boasts a rooftop terrace with stunning views of the city, including notable landmarks like Gran Via and the Metropolis building. Visitors can enjoy drinks at the rooftop cafe while taking in the panoramic scenery.

sources.snippet: From food to drink: Head to the rooftop bar on top of this cultural center or pick another of the many, many options all around town, but take your camera along wherever you decide to have your sundown tipple. While rooftop bars have fortunately become massively popular in Madrid, we want to recommend this particular one because it hits all the spots: great cocktails, great view, amazing interiors, and an interesting crowd. In fact, the way up to the bar is littered with gorgeous art deco stairways, lighting, and doorways for you to frame.
sources.shortName: The Best Madrid Photography Locations - Popular Spots

sources.snippet: In the summer, more often than not, you‚Äôll be able to find us on one of Madrid‚Äôs rooftops with a drink in hand. Each offers a view more stunning than the last, but none more so than the rooftop terrace atop the C√≠rculo de Bellas Artes building on the edge of Gran V√≠a. Spain‚Äôs most brilliant avenue positively shines from up above.
sources.shortName: Insider‚Äôs Guide to the Most Instagrammable Places in Madrid

sources.snippet: If you want views of the city centre from above, we have several proposals for you. First, there's C√≠rculo de Bellas Artes.In addition to being a very important cultural centre, its terrace has breathtaking views, although access costs 4‚Ç¨ and drinks are somewhat expensive.
sources.shortName: The best instagram corners of Madrid

sources.snippet: This gallery is an extraordinary site on its own, but what is the most fascinating for the photographers, is the rooftop terrace. It has an amazing view of the city, allowing you to grab the atmosphere of the central area in stunning photos.
sources.siteName: Hostal Madrid, habitaciones en el centro de Madrid
sources.shortName: The Best Places in Madrid to Take Great Pictures

sources.snippet: The views from the terrace of the C√≠rculo de Bellas Artes are also wonderful. You can take the photo with the sculpture of Athena, the goddess of wisdom. A place where it is also convenient to have a coffee and visit its exhibitions.
sources.shortName: Plans in Madrid: The best places to take photos in Madrid - Casual Hoteles | Web Oficial

sources.snippet: The rooftop of the C√≠rculo de Bellas Artes in Madrid happens to be ‚Äúprotected‚Äù by the goddess Minerva, just one of the many large mythological statues populating the city skyline. You just need to look up.
sources.shortName: Instagrammable spots in Madrid

places.name: C√≠rculo de Bellas Artes

reviews.text: Best to go a little early if you want a place in the evening. There is a queue but it's not too bad. The Sunset experience is great. This historic rooftop bar is one of the best in Madrid !!

Beautiful terraza. The rooftop is at the top of a theater and venue. Pay ‚Ç¨5.50 to enter. The drinks are not expensive. Hard to find a table to sit at first, but we found seating when a group left. Worth it.

We really enjoyed our visit overall. The exhibitions didn't particularly capture our interest, but of course that's a matter of personal taste. What we found especially nice was the space on the 3rd floor, where you can relax in hammocks, play chess, or simply escape the heat. And the Martini terrace is absolutely wonderful ‚Äì with its incredible view of the city, it's the perfect spot to stretch out on a comfortable sofa and enjoy a glass of Martini.

places.generalDescription: The Metropolis Building, located at the bustling intersection of Gran Via and Calle Alcala in Madrid, is a stunning example of Beaux-Arts architecture. This ornate structure, completed in 1911 as the headquarters for an insurance company, features intricate Corinthian columns and a gilded cupola topped with a statue called Winged Victory. The building's design was ahead of its time when it was built and has become one of Madrid's most famous landmarks.

sources.snippet: The Metropolis Building is one of Madrid‚Äôs most emblematic buildings so it is not surprising that it has stood front and center in an infinite number of cityscapes. Constructed in the early 20th century, it is located on the corner of the streets Alcal√° and Gran V√≠a. The sculpture-topped Renaissance facade subjects the building to an incessant flashing of photos by day and also by night when the illuminations are stunning.
sources.shortName: 10 of the most Instagrammable places in Madrid

sources.snippet: You may have seen this building pictured in many photos of Madrid. It was built recently, just in the 20th century and is topped with a Renaissance reminiscent sculpture at the top. The facades on the building help illuminate it at all times especially when lights flash against it.
sources.shortName: Best photography spots in Madrid Spain

sources.snippet: Our tour ends a block away at the ornate Metropolis Building. I have to admit that I am a bit embarrassed by the above shot. I was just learning to use my camera (still shooting on auto, mostly).
sources.shortName: My Favorite Photo Spots in Madrid

places.name: Metropolis Building

reviews.text: The Metropolis Building in Madrid is absolutely stunning. When you see it, you instantly know you are in Madrid. Its elegant architecture, intricate details, and golden dome make it one of the most beautiful landmarks in the city. Whether during the day or lit up at night, it is a breathtaking sight and a must see for anyone visiting Madrid.
Very nice architecture! Towering structure right in front of the main junction. Amazing place! Do visit and click photos here. Recommended!

The Metropolis Building in Madrid is a stunning example of Beaux Arts architecture, located at the corner of Gran V√≠a and Calle de Alcal√°. Built in 1911, it's famous for its elegant white fa√ßade, ornate details, and black dome crowned with a golden statue. Though not open to the public, it's a popular photo spot and a must-see for anyone exploring central Madrid. You can see this iconic building when reach city center (:

places.generalDescription: Campo del Moro Park is a historic garden located on 20 acres with steep slopes, streams, paths, and trees. The park features two monumental fountains and is inspired by the royal gardens of England. Its name translates to 'The Field of the Moor,' referencing the Moors' historical attempt to capture Madrid in the 12th century. Visitors can experience a sprawling English estate atmosphere while exploring this expansive space.

sources.snippet: At the back of the Palace, you will have access to this huge garden but the more appreciated spot is located on the left when climbing the stairs. You will have a beautiful view over the garden and the back facade of the palace, simply amazing!
sources.shortName: Top 10 Madrid Photo Spots

sources.snippet: Visit the gardens of Campo del Moro, adjacent to the Royal Palace, and meet these spectacular animals. There are also pheasants, turtledoves, parrots and ducks on the park‚Äôs 20 hectares.
sources.shortName: The best places in Madrid to take a photo

places.name: Campo del Moro

reviews.text: Love this park. If you're looking for a little escape from the heat, this place is perfect.

We saw a peacock expanding its feathers and this is a common thing for them and a reaction when they feels threatened or trying to mate during the season. Plenty of walking paths and feeling of being surrounded and submerged into the nature. Also there is a restaurant at the entrance via paseo de la Virgen del Puerto
Perfect location to alleviate the Madrid heat. Lots of tree canopies provide as much shade as you're going to get in the middle of Madrid. Some hidden curiosities along the perimeter trails‚Ä¶

places.address: P.¬∫ de la Virgen del Puerto, 1, Centro, 28013 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Gran V√≠a is a famous street in Madrid known for its stunning early-1900s architecture, bustling retail stores, and vibrant restaurants and bars. Often referred to as Madrid's Broadway, it offers an array of live performances, shows, comedy, and music near the nearby Plaza del Callao. Visitors can enjoy quality entertainment from national and international acts at little to no cost. The street is also home to numerous shops, affordable bars, and restaurants.

sources.snippet: The most iconic avenue of Madrid shows the city in her best light: that of an exciting, worldly and fun person with all sorts of secrets and incredible stories to tell, taking her rightful place in the center of attention where she belongs. Glittering boutiques, funky little shops, glamorous theaters and dingy comedy clubs, fine dining, and fast food joints ‚Äì all side by side, packed into one dizzyingly attractive package. Who hasn‚Äôt seen a picture of the famous Schweppes building and the cars passing underneath?
sources.shortName: The Best Madrid Photography Locations - Popular Spots

sources.snippet: Full of theaters, cinemas, music shows and fancy restaurant, Gran Via has earned the right to be called the ‚Äúbroadway‚Äù of Madrid. Here you will find all you need to entertain and have colorful photos for your Instagram. In Gran Via you will find some of the most iconic buildings of Madrid as Metropolis and Carri√≥n (better known as edificio Schweppes) and a cool vibe that will catch you in a minute.
sources.shortName: 10 OF THE MOST INSTAGRAMMABLE PLACES IN MADRID ‚Äì Madrid Photo Tour ‚Äì Things to do, activities and what to see in Madrid

sources.snippet: Next head up to Gran V√≠a, a wide shopping thoroughfare bisecting the city and littered with examples of early 20th-century architecture. The iconic neon Schweppes billboard lights up the top of the Carrion Building, imposing itself over the shoppers below. Note that better shots can probably be had if you can find your way to the top of one of the nearby buildings ( see here for examples).
sources.shortName: My Favorite Photo Spots in Madrid

sources.snippet: Gran V√≠a, Madrid‚Äôs bustling main thoroughfare, is an essential photography spot in the city. With its grand architecture, neon signs, and lively atmosphere, Gran V√≠a offers a glimpse into Madrid‚Äôs modern spirit. For a humorous twist, try capturing the expressions of shoppers as they hunt for the latest fashion trends or indulge in the city‚Äôs famous churros con chocolate.
sources.shortName: Madrid Photography Spots: Capturing the Spirit of Spain's Vibrant Capital

sources.snippet: Lined with shops, theatres, cinemas and restaurants, it never seems to sleep. The corner of the famous Metropolis building might be the most photographed. And there are several vantage points where you can get really good views, such as the rooftop bar of the C√≠rculo de Bellas Artes.
sources.shortName: Instagrammable spots in Madrid

sources.snippet: Gran V√≠a is one of the most famous streets in Madrid, especially for its impressive buildings and nightlife. It is the perfect place to photograph the city lit up at night. You can take pictures from different heights, such as from nearby buildings or from street level.
sources.shortName: The best locations for photo shoots in Madrid
Most Instagrammable Places In Madrid

sources.snippet: Gran Via is the shopping avenue of Madrid, similar to Fifth Avenue in New York City. It has some amazing architecture with lots of buildings from the late 19th century. You can do some shopping, people watch and snap some pictures here.
sources.siteName: The Solo Travel in Style Blog
sources.shortName: The best Madrid Instagram spots for top pictures

places.name: Gran V√≠a

reviews.text: One of the best streets in Madrid. Amazing architecture all around, top brand outlets, restaurants, casino, all great vibes. A must visit area in Madrid. We came here around 4pm and the place was buzzing and all lively even then. Do visit! I recommend
Lively and fun! Enjoyed visiting this place where you find almost everything from food, clothes and luxury. Recommended to visit
Amazing place to shop and stay. Such a lively place.

places.generalDescription: The Museum of Illusions Madrid is a must-visit attraction for families and anyone seeking mind-bending experiences. This popular spot in Madrid offers a variety of exhibits and installations that will challenge your perception of reality. From the funky rotated room to the Infinity Room with no boundaries, visitors can test gravity in the Anti-Gravity room and walk through the dizzying Vortex Tunnel.

sources.snippet: This tour covers different rooms all equally surprising and captivating. You will question everything appearing right before your eyes so you‚Äôd better capture it. It will be hard to believe otherwise‚Ä¶.
sources.shortName: The best instagram corners of Madrid

sources.snippet: This is the case of museums like Museum of Illusions Madrid, IKONO, Sweet Space Museum, Nomad Immersive Museum or the Happiness Museum.
sources.shortName: The best places in Madrid to take a photo

places.name: Museum of Illusions Madrid

reviews.text: Absolutely entertaining from start to finish! The Museum of Illusions in Madrid kept us all fully engaged - we could've easily spent two hours exploring. The installations are clever, interactive, and truly high quality. My kids had a blast, and honestly, so did I. Every room is picture perfect, and the staff made sure the flow was easy and fun. Whether you're going with kids or just want to play with perspective and be wowed, this spot delivers.

I was there with my family. The museum isn't very big, but it has a lot of potential if they organized the time slots better. When it's too crowded, people tend to rush through just to get their picture, or they give you unfriendly looks if you take your time - which makes the experience more uncomfortable than enjoyable.

Besides that, having tripods available in a few spots for group pictures, or even as rentals, would be useful.

Overall, my family had fun, but we would've enjoyed it more if it hadn't been so crowded.

Wow! What a great museum! If you want to find where the magic is at in Madrid, look no further! Offering many illusions for you to try out and capture, this museum is incredibly fun for everyone of all ages except people who otherwise have vertigo, as some of the illusions you will have to walk through may not be good for people with vertigo.
If you are wanting a fun activity to do with your kids, it's a great place! Depending on your pace, you could be at this museum for a while. My favourite illusion was the vortex, as it is a really cool experience and it really makes you feel like you are spinning in an actual vortex. If that's your thing, it is the last illusion downstairs at the very end of the room. This museum is also not far from the train line, so you can travel here easily.
In sum, if you're wanting something to do while you're in Madrid, come here!

places.address: Calle del Dr Cortezo, 8, Centro, 28012 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Sabatini Garden is a neoclassical garden located within the grounds of the Royal Palace in Madrid, Spain. It features three terraces adorned with fountains, statues, and hosts outdoor events. The gardens offer magnificent views at any time but are especially spectacular at dusk, making it a romantic spot to catch the sunset. Opened to the public in 1978, these symmetrical geometric gardens boast a large rectangular pool, marble statues, graceful fountains, and shady trees.

sources.snippet: Constructed in 1738, the Royal Palace of Madrid was once the official residence of the Spanish Royal family. Nowadays, it is used exclusively for receptions, official acts, and state ceremonies. The stately building stretches across Plaza de la Armer√≠a, with rows of arches and columns immediately capturing your attention.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places to Take Photos in Madrid

sources.snippet: The Sabatini Gardens (Jardines de Sabatini) are located right behind the palace. The most beautiful spot of the gardens is the fountain. Sitting along the pond with the Royal Palace in the background is the perfect Insta-worthy photo spot.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Places in Madrid

sources.snippet: After you learn everything about the history of the Royal Palace, head to the beautiful gardens of the Royal Palace. They are located on the right hand side of the palace. The gardens are well manicured and so peaceful.
sources.siteName: The Solo Travel in Style Blog
sources.shortName: The best Madrid Instagram spots for top pictures

sources.snippet: These gardens are just behind the royal palace and are perfect to take a stroll and some photos. You‚Äôll find a lot of tourists and locals alike here as these gardens are beautiful and well kept.
sources.shortName: Best Fall Photo Spots in Madrid

sources.snippet: The best time to visit these gardens is early in the morning before anyone else gets there. You‚Äôll definitely want the time and quiet to explore this beautiful space.
sources.shortName: Best photography spots in Madrid Spain

places.name: Sabatini Garden

reviews.text:
The whole area is great for walking as it isn't a huge place but still pretty sizable. There's a couple small fountains all around (some didn't seem to be operating though), a pond in the middle of the garden, statues surrounding the whole area (up the stairs, around the pond, etc) but suprisingly not a ton of flowers around and more just bushes and trees. The whole area does seem well taken care of as well.

There's also stairs surrounding the garden that you'll either have to go down to reach the garden or up after looking around but is definitely worth taking time to take pictures or selfies as it's a very nice view from atop. There are a ton of other attractions around as well such as Plaza de Espa√±a, Templo de Debod, Palacio Real de Madrid, Puerta de San Vicente, and way more worth seeing.
With the green of Spring, the gardens are a must visit in Madrid perfect for hours of walking and relaxing

Beautiful area to explore.

It is partially shut at the moment for reconstruction but the walk around it was delightful.

There was a few locals playing instruments at the centre and it was lovely to sit and listen.

places.address: C. de Bail√©n, 2, Centro, 28013 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Parque de la Quinta de los Molinos is a former estate transformed into a 25-hectare park in the heart of Madrid. It's known for its stunning display of blooming almond trees, which number around 6,000 and create a beautiful spectacle of pink and white hues during spring. The park offers various amenities such as running paths, a botanical trail, and sports areas.

sources.snippet: The Quinta de los Molinos Park is located in the north east of the city. It is one of the most beautiful and romantic places of the city and especially during spring when the almond trees start to flourish. You will be surrounded by vibrant pink flowers and green grass, creating a perfect contrast and even more beautiful with the natural light of the sun.
sources.shortName: Top ten Instagram worthy spots in Madrid

sources.snippet: There is no better way to welcome spring than by visiting the blossoming almond trees at Quinta de los Molinos.The two weeks of flowering vary from year to year depending on the weather, but they tend to be around January and February, so watch out for the news on those dates!
sources.shortName: The best instagram corners of Madrid

sources.snippet: The almond trees in blossom at Quinta de los Molinos is a sight worthy of photographing. It is a public garden close to IFEMA MADRID and the Atl√©tico de Madrid stadium.
sources.shortName: The best places in Madrid to take a photo

places.name: Parque de la Quinta de los Molinos

reviews.text: Beautiful place. If you want some space for a picnic make sure to go early!

Named after the molinos (old mills) once located on the estate-possibly used for grain or tobacco-the park originated as a quinta (rural estate) in the early 20th century. It was once owned by the Count of Torre Arias and later donated in 1920 to C√©sar Cort Bot√≠, who designed its gardens and villa. In 1980, it was designated a public historic park through an agreement with the city council. The park features groves of olive, stone pine, eucalyptus, and especially almond trees. These almond blossoms create a spectacular scene from mid-February to early March, typically lasting around 13 days. Besides its natural charm, the park also houses cultural spaces including a greenhouse, a historic villa, and Espacio Abierto.

Another hidden gem in Madrid full of Almond trees that bloom from mid-March to beginning of April. The trees are amazing when in bloom, but the park itself is lovely at any time of the year. You can take the 146 bus from the center of Madrid, the Suances metro stop or go by car. The parking on the weekend is scarce. There is a duck pond worth visiting as well. You can bring your dog and have a nice walk or even a picnic!

places.address: C. Alcal√°, 527, San Blas-Canillejas, 28027 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: Embark on a delightful adventure at the Sweet Space Museum, an innovative attraction nestled in Madrid's ABC Serrano shopping center. This vibrant space is a feast for the senses, featuring ten interactive themed rooms that are perfect for capturing Instagram-worthy moments. Marvel at whimsical installations like a mesmerizing lollipop waterfall and candy-floss palm trees while immersing yourself in kaleidoscopic art created by renowned international artists such as Agatha Ruiz de la Prada and Antonyo Marest.

sources.snippet: It is an experiential museum through different themed rooms. It might has nothing to do with Dopamine Land except for the tons of pictures you can (and have to) take here too. Show your sweetest side.
sources.shortName: The best instagram corners of Madrid

sources.snippet: This is the case of museums like Museum of Illusions Madrid, IKONO, Sweet Space Museum, Nomad Immersive Museum or the Happiness Museum.
sources.shortName: The best places in Madrid to take a photo

places.name: Sweet Space Museum

reviews.text: Omg, it is such a great place to spend an hour or more. Each room is completely different, not only because of the art, but also the experience just to look at them, touch them, feel them, and have different activities, a lot to see and enjoy. They even decorated the whole place with Halloween decoration in October. We enjoyed the sweets as well which we got in the different rooms. The sour one was very sour! :) Highly recommended, don't forget to wear clothes which have white writing/art on them because there are a lot of rooms where it is glowing in the dark :)

if you could ask my 2 year old he would say 'it was the best'

I've been to what they're imitating elsewhere in the world (frameless/boarder less, art exhibitions) and they've done well with the space but there's lots of room for improvement

The hanging balls could have more mirrors on the floor as the space is small
Some of the sweets we're pretty disgusting, some were all over the floor when we got the sour ones, I didn't see a single adult not spit it out
The soft play zone had too many wooden edges so you didn't feel like it was very protected
The last room was probably the best in terms of atmosphere/fun. glad they had 2 separate ball pits for different age groups

It was good for what it was and children will have fun, for ‚Ç¨18 and adult, ‚Ç¨0 for under 3's. staff were good and accomodating in English. Wouldn't rush to do it again and other cities have much much better options for children, Madrid this was all they had for a rainy day
Great huge ballpit, slide, sensory spaces, candy. Came with my 3 year old on a Saturday morning. Awesome way to entertain and bond üëç

places.address: C. de Serrano, 61, Planta 2, Salamanca, 28006 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: In the heart of Madrid's bustling Puerta del Sol square stands the iconic "El Oso y el Madro√±o" sculpture, depicting a bear reaching for fruit from a strawberry tree. Created by a renowned Spanish artist in 1967, this 4-meter-tall bronze statue has become a beloved symbol of the city. Puerta del Sol is not only a popular meeting spot but also offers shopping and vibrant nightlife.

sources.snippet: El Oso y el Madro√±o, or ‚Äòthe Bear and the Strawberry Tree‚Äô, is a symbol of Madrid. The statue is located in Puerta del Sol and represents the coat of arms of Madrid and is a popular meeting point and an iconic design. The sculpture‚Äôs details and the surrounding bustling square make it an excellent spot for dynamic and rich photos.
sources.shortName: 17 Best Madrid Instagram Spots in 2025
Most Instagrammable Places In Madrid

places.name: El Oso y el Madro√±o

reviews.text: El Oso y el Madro√±o is such a charming symbol of Madrid! Seeing the iconic bear reaching for the tree in the middle of bustling Puerta del Sol made me smile. It's a fun, meaningful landmark - perfect for photos and a must-see if you're exploring the heart of the city.

I didn't know this cute statue of the bear and Strawberry tree existed till I came out the Sol Metro station and had to take a picture.

It is very popular and lots of people were taking pictures.

The statue is a considerable size and very cute. Be mindful of your belongings when taking pictures as a lady startled me when she came from behind to ask for money for something she was trying to sell.

Be conscious of your surroundings and keep personal belongings secure especially during busy periods.

Well hello Madrid, where the sun shines bright and the tapas are plentiful. But there's a different kind of snack that's been standing in the heart of the city for centuries. I'm talking about the iconic statue of The Bear and the Strawberry Tree (?) tree?

According to the tour guide, This bronze statue isn't just a landmark; it's a personality. A stoic bear casually reaching for a piece of fruit from a tree. The bear represents the city's strength and wild animal population, and the tree symbolizes the land and its resources. (I said strawberry tree yes).

Now, let's me explain the strawberry tree, I had to look it up; while it's called the "strawberry tree," the strawberries we know and love don't actually grow on trees. Right? The tree in the statue is a strawberry tree (is called Arbutus unedo, a n actual real fruit-bearing tree native to the Mediterranean region whose fruit looks similar to a strawberry. So while it's not the strawberry for your ice cream, it's a fitting symbol for Madrid's wild past.

This statue represents a serious medieval dispute. The city's official emblem commemorates a resolution between the city council and the clergy over rights to the forests and resources. They settled the debate by dividing the land, with the clergy getting the forests and the city gaining rights to the animals and other resources.

This historical resolution serves as a powerful reminder of the importance of the separation of church and state. It's a timeless principle that we still debate today. The Bear and the Strawberry Tree, in its quiet corner of Madrid, shows us that these conversations have been happening for centuries.

places.address: Prta del Sol, 1, Centro, 28013 Madrid, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Greenhouse Crystal Palace of Arganzuela, also known as Palacio de Cristal, is a remarkable glass and metal structure situated in the heart of Retiro Park. Designed by architect Ricardo Velazquez Bosco in 1887, it was originally built to showcase exotic plants from the Philippines. Today, it serves as one of the venues for the Reina Sofia National Art Museum and is a popular attraction within the park.

sources.snippet: As one of Europe‚Äôs greenest capitals, Madrid features many peaceful parks where you can snap some photos as you stroll. The most famous, Retiro Park, is an especially tranquil glass palace built right in the middle of the lush green gardens. On Madrid‚Äôs more than 300 sunny days per year, the sunlight reflects off of the glass panels in a way that‚Äôs practically magical.
sources.shortName: Insider‚Äôs Guide to the Most Instagrammable Places in Madrid

sources.snippet: The famous Retiro Park is home to the Palacio de Cristal, a glass and wrought iron structure built in 1887 that today is one of the offices of the Reina Sof√≠a Museum. With incomparable surroundings, this luminous building is incredibly photogenic. We especially like it in autumn when the colors of nature add a warm touch.
sources.shortName: 10 of the most Instagrammable places in Madrid

sources.snippet: It is a complete glass and wrought iron building that is nestled perfectly within the lush greenery of the landscape. It was constructed in 1887 and now serves as a museum office. It looks great with the water fountain in front and especially in the fall with the colorful leaves surrounding it.
sources.shortName: Best photography spots in Madrid Spain

sources.snippet: Located in El Retiro Park, Palacio de Cristal ‚Äî or Crystal Palace ‚Äî is a shining example of Madrid‚Äôs cast-iron architecture. Originally built as a greenhouse in 1887, Crystal Palace is now owned by the Reine Sofia Museum and is used as a venue to host temporary exhibitions.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places to Take Photos in Madrid

sources.snippet: The Crystal Palace , in the Retiro Park, is a very photogenic glass and iron building. The Palace with the lake and the trees that surround it assure you a beautiful photograph. You can also take advantage and see the exhibition that is exhibited at that time.

sources.snippet: Crystal Palace (Palacio Cristal) is our favorite building in Retiro Park and you really can‚Äôt miss it during your visit. Entrance to the building is free of charge and it‚Äôs a beautiful insta-worthy spot. Play with the shadows from the structure on sunny days.

places.name: Greenhouse Crystal Palace of Arganzuela

reviews.text: This place is great. Free to enter and a ton of great mature plants to see. There are 4 sections. 2 Tropical, one Sub-Tropical and one Desert. We went on a Saturday around noon and it wasn't overly busy. We took our time and really enjoyed the place. If you are in the area for sure make a stop.
Free entrance,  no lines and not crowded. Very peaceful and relaxing with picturesque areas and various plants.
Very nice collection, free, and super chill. I loved visiting ü•∞
